topic.title: HP Helion Openstack Carrier Grade (Beta): Managing Access to a Flavor

body.p: Compute flavors are machine configurations that describe the amount of memory, number of CPUs, and storage capacity of instances.
As an admin, you can allow specific projects to have access to a flavor or prevent a project from accessing a flavor.

section.title: Allowing a project to access a flavor

li.p: Launch the HP Helion Openstack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Flavors link.
The flavors for in the domain are listed.
For the flavor you want to modify, click Edit Flavor > Modify Access.
Click the + icon next to a project in the All Projects column to allow the project to access the flavor.
By default, no project is specified as having access the flavor. If none is specified, all projects can access the flavor.
Click Save to create a new the flavor.
A message is displayed on successful change.

section.title: Preventing a project from accessing a flavor

li.p: Launch the HP Helion Openstack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the System panel, then the Admin dashboard, then the Flavors link.
The flavors for in the domain are listed.
For the flavor you want to modify, click Edit Flavor > Modify Access.
Click the - icon next to a project in the Selected projects column to remove the flavor from the project.
By default, no project is specified as having access the flavor. If none is specified, all projects can access the flavor.
Click Save to create a new the flavor. A message is displayed on successful change.
